Rami Rami is drinking a Hesjeøl by HaandBryggeriet at Jabeerwocky

Sporo slodu, troche chleba, ciut ogniska, nieco przypraw, niemalo ciala, slodkawe... dziwne ale mile
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. W pół drogi między saisonem i weizenbockiem, ciekawe piwo.
Traditional, indeed. Slightly hazy copper colour. Nearly no head to speak of. Strong aroma of fresh grains (especially rye) and grass. Moderately bitter taste with a mineral element.

Bottle. Sensoric. Medium amber to dark brown, moderately hazy large, frothy, off-white head. Good lacing and moderate head retention. Aroma is moderately malty (pale, caramel), also smoked - some kind artificial, woody. Light to moderate spicy, yeasty (earthy), dried fruits and leather notes. Lightly hoppy - some pine needles, fruity. Moderately sweet taste with light to medium bitterness, which starts from the middle and becomes moderate even to heavy. Medium body, oily texture, rather soft carbonation, finish is semi-bitter, long, mineral with grassy and herbal hoppy notes. In general another unconditional beer from HaandBryggeriet with strong, harsh nature accents - woody, smokey, leathery, earthy. One again big complexity of aromas and flavors, nicely combined with malts, moderately drinkable.
Bottle. Unclear, dark honey color. Aroma: lightest smoked malt, honey, herbs, spicy. Taste: smoked bacon, malt, mild hops bitterness, wine, unusual, but good.
bread, caramel, toast, CORPO PIENO E ROTONDO COME TUTTE LE BIRRE DI HAAND, FANTASTICA

4/VII/16 - 50cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ Adam Jackson Tasting Without Adam Jackson - BB: 14/I/17 (2016-728) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, big creamy off-white head, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: malty, soapy, floral, bit fruity, honey, rather sweet. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: pretty smoky start, sweet malts, sugary, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: smoky, bitter, malty, grains, hay, meh.

The Scandinavian beer revolution does not neglect its own traditions, and many of these new craft breweries there come up with recreations of ancient Nordic ales regularly. This is one such example, though, as with the stories surrounding saison, I find it hard to imagine that a 6.5% ABV beer (or originally even 7%) would serve as a thirst quencher for landworkers during harvest, as the label claims... Thinnish, bubbly, off-white, regular head leaving a rim around the edge and some thin patches in the middle but eventually dissolving into completely nothing; almost clear amberish orange colour with a suspension of tiny yeast bits throughout, becoming a completely cloudy amber with sediment. Aroma of (mildly) smoked bacon, dried orange peel and bitter orange, freshly grated ginger, dried juniper berries, roasted peanuts, cigarette tobacco, chicken spices, curcuma, toasted bread, roasted bell pepper, clove-like phenols and a lot of them, faint strawberry sweetishness peeping through, horseradish. Fruity onset, dried peach, hints of redcurrant, mandarin and red apple, only very vaguely sweetish, more sourish, mineral accents here and there, softish carbo, supple and lean mouthfeel, spicy phenols showing up shyly at first but growing in strength later on. These impressions continue over a smooth nutty malt middle gaining a soft, toasted bittering edge in the end, while drying spiciness and hoppiness add more substantial bitterness, resulting in a medium long to long bitter finish, peppery and leafy with an earthy yeast quality accentuating it especially after adding the sediment; juniper berry- and vaguely clove-like spicy notes rise up retronasally but fortunately not in an obnoxious way. Label does not mention spices so I assume these effects are from a purely phenolic nature and indeed, it can easily be established that this is a very phenolic beer, albeit not unpleasantly so; it is, however, rather unusual and a bit untidy, with a deep hop bitterness and hop aromas almost reminiscent of the old English style IPA... Feels somewhat unbalanced; perhaps some more rounded malt sweetness could make it better, but then, who am I to judge how an ancient Norwegian thirst quencher should taste like... That being said, there is little or no reference on the label to actual historical sources, so I have a suspicion that this is only traditional ale by inspiration (and some extent of imagination), and not so much from a truly physical and technical point of view. Remains the question: is it a pleasant beer? It has a phenolic character which is all too strong for my personal liking and the deep hop bitterness could be better balanced or more elegantly put, but on the other hand, it has certain characteristics which remind me of Orval, and that works to its benefit, I guess, though it does not come close to that standard.  It does, however, speak for a Belgian, in some respects saison-like influence, bringing me back to my abovementioned point of this probably being not too authentically Scandinavian at all in terms of style and pedigree. Ill give it the benefit of the doubt.
50 cl bottle. Hazy amber no head. Funk aroma, smoke, saison yeast. Malt flavour, cinnamon notes, smokey, some bitterness
Pours cloudy copper with a finger of white head. Aroma of smoke, floral notes, light peat. Taste is sweet and smoky with a peaty finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Bardzo obfita, drobna, biała piana, która ochoczo sama wychodzi z butelki jak i ze szkła. Barwa bursztynowo czerwona, mętna, intensywnie uwalniające się drobne bąbelki. W aromacie sporo jabłek, gruszek, winogron i ogólnie białych owoców z siankiem na końcu - baaardzo przyjemnie. Smak półwytrawny, jest lekka kwaskowość porzeczkowa, delikatna słodycz moreli, skórki od chleba i czerwony pieprz na finiszu. O ile aromat bliższy białym, o tyle smak bliższy czerwonym owocom w połączeniu z belgijskim Saisonem. Goryczka niska, przyprawowa. W odczuciu drobniusieńkie, intensywne nagazowanie, posmaki ziołowe, delikatne funky i mineralność.
Bardzo złożone, wielowymiarowe piwo. Od silnej owocowości w aromacie, poprzez niewielką kwaskowość, słodowość, estrowość i fenolowośc w smaku, do zagrodowych, lekko dzikich i ziemistych wtrętów w afterteasie.
Flaske. Spesiell øl. Aroma og smak er litt røkt, som røkt spekekjøtt eller kaviar. Vanskelig å si, bacon kanskje? Som sagt ganske spesiell. Mange elementer.

On tap at The Thomas Tallis Canterbury. Haze amber orange colour lasting ivory head. . Belgian ale? Toffee. Smokey hefe aroma. Its full toffee banana in the mouth some sweetness. Just a very interesting beer. Bizarre. Herb.
Uklart karamell brunt med skum som forsvinner fort. Lukten er preget av røyk,torv og lett frukt. Søt røyk og karamell i smaken. Medium munnfølelse.
Roodbruin bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig met iets van bessen.
Dark blond colour. Theres a light smokiness in the aroma. Flavour is very floral and herbal. Light body.

(butelka warka 702, dp: 07.01.2016) Piwo jest przegazowane i nalewa się z bardzo bujną i grubo-pęcherzykową pianą, która cieniutka warstwą pozostaje do końca picia. Barwa bursztynowa, piwo jest mętne. 
Aromat jest średnio-intensywny i kojarzy się ze skisłymi słodkimi cytrusami. W tle pojawia się zapach wyprawionej skóry oraz delikatne nuty miodowe i przyprawowe.
W smaku piwo jest mocno wysycone. Słodkie pieczywo, po chwili przykrywane są owocowymi posmakami (brzoskwinie, morele). Finisz lekko przyprawowy, cierpki i delikatnie kwaśny. Przypomina posmak niedojrzałych jagód.
Midlebrown colour, unclear/Unfiltrered. tick texture. Spacey and smoked aroma that dominate the body of the taste. Fresh head and smoky end. Will taste again:-)
Hazy copper with white head. Smoked bacon, bread and caramel. Light, herbal, malty, sweet and light hoppy finish. Overall: Great aroma and light palate.

Niemal doskonale piwo, mocno metne az przyklejony osad, nie sposob go wymieszac z dna butelki. Piwo o pomaranczowo miedzianej barwie, sporej piance srednio trwalej. Zapach lekko przegnitych pomaranczy brzoskwin. W smaku slodowe lekko slodkie ale kwaskowe ciut ze spora dawka zborzowych wrazen i chlebowej skorki. Polecam to tradycyjne farmerskie Ale
Clear amber body with low head. Aroma has light bacon roastiness, malty, light alcoholic. Taste has medium roasty sweetness, earthy bitterness. Spicy. Body is mediium but dry, high carbonation.

Bottle at a tasting. Lots of spices in this one, clove, badyan. Really high spice intensity. The finish reveals that some of it has hops origin, also citrusy zesty elements. Then spicy again. Quite a rollercoaster of flavour. But good.
Bottle. Clear golden orange colour, white head. Aroma is spicy, some fruits- apricots, peach. Taste is spicy and fruity too, yeast in taste. Quite dry end. Gold one.

500 ml bottle shared by Rusos at Bratislava Tasting, thanks!
Amber, moderately hazy body, with a medium, creamy, off-white head.
Aroma of moderate smoke, spices, bread, orange zest, citrus, some sweet malts.
Taste follows this, with more sweet malts, like honey.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes spicy, a bit smokey, dry hoppy, a bit malty.

Nice one. Greatly balanced between the smokey, the malty and some hoppy notes. Drinks pretty easy. Not my favourite beer from this brewery, but enjoyable.

500ml bottle shared by rusos at Bratislava RB Tasting, big thanks. dark orange hazy color, small white head. smells light smoke, sausages, spices, a bit citric, some more fruits. decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of light smoke, spices, citric, oranges, also some grass, very lightly sweet. finishes with oranges and spices also some light grassy bitterness. decent stuff, quite like it, taste a bit better than the smell.
Hazy light orange body with white head. Smells bread, citrus, orange, spices, roasted. Tastes lightly hoppy, smoky, spices, a little sweet, leaves light bitter after taste.
Bottle at tasting, Gurthnars place. Hazy Orange golden color with small white head. Malty, hoppy aroma. Peach, oranges, tangerines, yeast, spices in taste. Good.
Bottle at Joined Slovak&Austian ratebeer session 10/2015. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of malty, honey, caramel, bread, spicy. Taste is sweet, orange, tangerines, yeasty, malty, peach.
Passe fyldig, ikke så lett og friskt som forventet. Ikke noen tørsteslukker. Nydelig hint av røyksmak. Kjempegodt øl til kos. Antakeligvis for kraftig til mat.

Bottle, batch #900. Aroma is hay, grass, flowers, herbs, some belgian yeast-notes. Dark golden amber, hazy, small off-white head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, taste is light malts, biscuits, bread, bread crust, yeast, floral notes, herbal notes. Light/medium body, average carbonation, long bitter finsih. Nice farmhouse ale.

Bärnstensfärgad, rejält disig med medelstort vitt skum som lägger sig snabbt. I doften finns massor av gräs, blommor och örter plus en liten fruktighet och aningen rök. Smaken är lite kärv med mycket gräs och örter, liten rökighet, liten fruktsötma av mogna äpplen, avslutningen är kryddig, lite pepprig men den bra beska. Lagom kolsyra, fin munkänsla. En riktigt läcker slåtteröl!

Pours dark golden and hazy with a 2 finger off-white head that diminishes to a thin layer rather quickly. Aroma is sweetish; light smoked malt, coriander, pepper, bubblegum, hay, flowers, perhaps some juniper fruit. The taste is dominated by spices, with a strong malt base and a nice bitter and sour finish that morphs smoothly into a peppery aftertaste. Medium to low spicy bitterness, medium to high carbonation, medium body. This is a most intriguing beer. Its something between a Saison, Sahti and Rosanke. Drinkable, thirst quenching, refreshing and yet heavy enough to seem satiating. This is exactly how I picture a harvest ale. Definitely one worth repeating.

Bottle from Cunningham, huge thanxxx my friend!
Best before date was 2 months ago. Slight gushing. Pours clear, copper colored with a soapy longlasting head. Aroma has very lovely smoked malts and lots of spicy notes. Taste of smoked malts, caramel, spices, some farmhouse yeast. Later, it has some fruity notes, especially pear and peach. Finish has again delicious smoked malts, as well as some peach and spices. Awesome beer, indeed!!!

Bottle. Pours all hazy dark orange with frothy off-white head. Aroma is quite saisonish, ripe fruits, peach, pear, canned pear, malty sweetness and some subtle rustic bonfire smoke. Taste has loads of fruits, some pear and peach, eatery and slight spices. Malty background. High carbonation and medium body, but dries out by the smoke and bonfire. Really interesting! Slight bitter too.

Bottle thanks to Magnus. Pours a deep amber with a big, white head. Aroma has lots of grains, slight smoke, lots of spicy, floral yeast, sweet esters, wool sweater after a night next to a campfire. Taste has more, but a subtle smoke. Sweet malts and lots of grains, slight hoppy finish. Very high carbonation and a crisp mouth feel. Exciting and well balanced.

500ml bottle, many thanks to Gunnar! Pours a hazy deep amber with large white head. Fresh spicy aroma. Taste is fresh saison yeast with a floral sweetness and a curious herbal character all of its own. Very nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks tomer. Cloudy amber, white head. Stale, limestone, a little smoke and banana aroma, sweet and spicy taste, a little sour, a little bubblegum. Medium body, very drinkable, spicy finish.

At a tasting, thanks Gunnar, fluffy bubbly small stable head, hazy deep orange color, yeasty rubbery aroma, with a hint of citrus, fruitiness in the back and some shrubs, light yeasty flavor, light biscuity maltiness and some fruit, mrdium bodied, quite malty and lightly sweet, but with a pleasant bitterness. Good and satisfying.

Bottle, bb 29.09.2016, batch 795. Amber, a bit cloudy beer with dense, creamy, beautiful white head. Aromas of spices, some saison and floral notes. Medium bitterness. High carbonation. Interesting, refreshing beer.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2015 Bottle at home. Pours cloudy amber with big, but long lasting white head. Aroma of hay, smoke, spices, honey. Taste sweet with dry finish. Bitter-sweet aftertaste. Smoked malt quite distinct. High carbonation.

500ml bottle, probably from Bergen duty free quaffed at home watching Lillyhammer. Hazed orange capped with a narrow white drum of foam. Big waft of sahti/weizenbock esters imitating banana, clove, TCP and juniper. Quite a sniffer. Peppery spice, juicy wheat, banana and clove flavour straddling the imaginary Bavaria/Belgium border- could be anything in there; caraway, coriander, clove, juniper, just a shedload of demented yeast whipping the wheat into an aromatic frenzy. Knowing nothing of traditional Norwegian farmhouse ales Im still pretty convinced this is an authentic approximation. Lovely stuff.

Aromat: sporo nut zbożowych, w połączeniu z fenolami i owocowymi.
Wygląd: złoty, zmętniony, bardzo przyjemna piana
Smak: na pierwszym planie zbożowość, z napierającą po niej przyprawowością (wręcz lekko saisonem zajeżdża). Dość niskie wysycenie. Finisz owocowo - kwaskowaty. Bardzo pijalne piwo.

500ml bottle. Deep apricot brown liquid with thick lasting two finger white head. Sweet fruity aroma with clear elements of wheat such as a sligt bana smell. Equally sweet flavor with elements of wheat, ripe fruits and smooth malts. Light smooth mouthfeel with low carbonation, refreshing.

The beer is has a dark Amber chocolate apperance with a pillowy off white head. The head retention holds up well. The beer has a metallic rust aroma and a slight wet slate character. A slight smokyness lingers also, and is it warms some bright esters become present . No hop aromatics are present. The beer is highly carbonated. The smoky aro.antics comes out more prevelant in the taste. The smoky taste plays well with the chocolate toasty flavor. The carbonation is a bit higher then desired as the bottle started to foam over even after the first pour. I needs some work but I like the concept.
How: Bottle Appearance: hazy golden color Aroma: citrus, grass, hay, herbs.. Palate: medium body, smooth carbonation.

Fruits, citrus, yeast, lightly roasted notes and a hint of spices in the aroma. Amber with a off-white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a flavorful and refreshing ale.
Rødbrun og klar,med lukt og smak av humle og malt,grei ettersmak,en grei norsk øl

0,5l bottle. Hazy,gold brown,caramel head. Nice aroma of hops, yeast and a hint of pineapple. Really interwoven taste, but mainly sour and heavily astringent. Too bitter for my taste. Overpowers the spices.

Bottle (500 ml). Slight hazy bright dark golden with a medium fully lasting off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is a nice mix of herbal/floral presence and smokey notes along light berries, moderate spiciness and hints of caramel. Taste is moderately herbal/floral and spicy with smokey notes, hints of caramel/malt, berries notes and earthy presence. Medium body. Very active bubbles. Light lingering smokey finish. Quite tasty beeer. Nice balance between herbs and smoke. Carbonation level is a tad too high. Well done!

Aroma: earthy, malty, some wilde yeast notes in the background
Taste: citrus, earthy, low bitterness, low sourness
Very good beer :)
Bottle from Den Nordiske Ølhandel, Copenhagen - pours amber with a off-white head. Fruity and malty aroma and taste, some light smoke, some floral and herbal spice notes. Nice.

500ml bottle purchased at Knightly Spirits in Orlando, Florida. Orange in colour with an off-white head, good retention and good lacing. Aroma is musty, some berry skins, some smoke, perfume. Flavour is a bit dirty, some berries, smoke, chocolate, sweet caramel, some yeast. Sweet mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbonation. Finishes long, sweet, malty.
Another strange beer from this brewery that I just cant help but liking.

How: Bottle.
Where: SMÖF 2014.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Mild malt, fruit, some hops, a bit floral.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, fruit, spices, some citrus.

Brown bottle, 500 ml, lot 632, brewed on 31.07.13, best before 31.07.15, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on October 28 2014; eye: amber, semi-hazy, nice effervescence, nice mocha head that maintains some thickness, light lacing; nose: malt, light yeast, slight smoky, fruity; mouth: malt, light yeast, smoky, fruity, smoky finale with presence of yeast, rather carbonated, lightly silky texture; overall: different

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, 6,5 %, lot 632, brassée le 31.07.13, meilleure avant le 31.07.15, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 28 octobre 2014; il : ambrée, semi-voilée, bonne effervescence, bonne mousse moka qui se maintient sous une bonne couverture, légère dentelle; nez : malt, léger levure, très léger fumé, fruité; bouche : malt, léger levure, fumé, fruité, finale en fumé avec présence de levure, plutôt carbonatée, texture légèrement soyeuse; en résumé : différente

Distinct hoppy aroma with hints of cloves. The taste is odd - some alcohol, a bit of weird malts with hints of figs and a leathery numbness. The aftertaste is weak and numb, I dislike it somewhat. Not surprising that the taste can not follow up the excellent aroma.

Purchased at Sola Airport duty-free in a 50cl bottle. Batch number 774. Hazy red-gold colour with a firm white head that clings to the glass, and a fruity, hoppy aroma. Taste is full of rich malts with a very subtle hint of smoke. Also fruity notes of Seville Orange marmalade and hops. The hop taste is well-defined and creates a great balance with the sweeter flavours of malts and fruit. Beautiful long, bitter finish. A really lovely well-balanced harvest beer.

Has a very interesting quality of smokiness along with a really nice depth of malts, a bit of a brown rice nutty character, some wild berry, a very strange but delicious beer as Ive come to expect from Haand.

(50 cl bottle from Heinemann Gardermoen; Batch #786; Bottled on July 30th 2014; BBD: July 30th 2016) Pours a clear amber with two finger white head that dissipates quickly leaving thin film and a ring of lace. Aroma is hay and grain with a hint of smoke. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation and a lingering, dry and slightly astringent finish. Flavour is aromalike. Not much sweetness, some smoke and a bit of alcohol. Very farmhouse-like yet clean and not funky. Reminds me of a triple but less yeas-defined.
Smells like harvest. Very suitable after doing garden work. Hint of smoke, tastes like farming.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

500 ml bottle. Pours a slightly veiled orange-golden very pale amber with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is cereals, toasty. Flavor is toasty, malty. Finish is rather clean herbal...dry. Lingering herbal hops. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, average to strong carbonation.
Amber color with a white head. Flavor has notes of spices and herbal traces, with some caramelish hints. Flavor is bittery with some caramel notes. Mild bittery final with a medium presence.

quite dense yellowish head. dark amber colour. aroma of rye, junipper berry, spices, leather, smoked malt, peach, peppery saison like. taste like aroma, caramel with a pronounced bitter finish. medium body and carbonation. a lot of flavours going on in this one, but for me it worked.  bottle 50cl
Litt skuffende. Fin topp og farge. Noe røykt i aroma og smak. Malt, jord, gress. Men også en bismak og bildet som minner om såpe.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie au coût de 9,05$. Arôme: Légère odeur de fumée et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux avec une large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de céréale fumée avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence dorange en arrière goût. (Rating #5657)

Kind of boring ale, honestly. Well made for sure but nothing that stands out that clearly. Haandbryggeriet might be the 2nd best Norwegian brewery but this effort shouldnt be anyones first beer from the brewery. Maybe its more the style that I dont enjoy that much. Try their "Dark force" instead.
500ml bottle at home. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of Belgian style yeast and bread with some smokiness. Sweet finish.
Lots of smoke - good foam head. A combination of a strong, smoky taste and refreshing. Accomplished.
Bottle during beer tasting at the Bunker, Copenhagen. Taste of smoke, roasted malts, well balanced.

Bottle 50 cl.
Hazy light brown, off-white head. Sweet, slightly sour aroma, with some malt. Medium sweet, some caramel, dry finish. The sum is more than the parts.
Very lovely ale. A little bit outdoorsy tree aroma. Great carbonation. Fizzles throughout the mouth. Easy and no bitterness.

50cl bottle. Color is dark gold to orange. Head is medium and white. Its slightly hazy. Taste is light sweet, high bitter, medium sour. Body is quite carbonated. Aroma and flavour is wood, roasted, smoke, herbs, fruits, wheat and malt.
Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig, holzig, rauchig. Geschmack malzig, hopfig, holzig, rauchig, Gewürze.

500 ml bottle @ home.May 13, 2014.Batch # 728.
Beer enjoyed from a tulip glass.
Beer bought @ "Vinmonopolet Vika", Oslo.
Dark golden to brown in color with a thick beige creamy head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is malt,smoke,hop,wood and some grass.
Tastes a bit smoky and malty with a bitter and lasting touch and finish.
A beer that probably fits food better than drinking it alone.
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color ambar. Sabor a levadura, malta, trigo.
Botella de 50 cl. De 1420 tomada en llamas en agosto de 2014. Lote 445 de 13-02-2012 hasta 13-02-2014. Buena, cuerpo medio con 6.5 vol que la hacen bastante fácil de beber. Se podría repetir.

Unclear amber. Off-white head and good lacing. Aroma of hops, barn and hay, with a subdued hint of smoked malt. Refreshing and hoppy taste and aftertaste. The use of smoked malt is discreet and balanced.

Bottle 500ml shared two ways. Amber pour with a nice thick white head. Aroma is smoky and meaty with some spices (cloves?). Very tasty and powerful smoke grain and yet very light bodied. As close to Schlenkerla as it can get, very surprised by this one.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white medium head. Aroma is wooden smoke, toasted malt, berries, pine, grass and straw. Taste is light+ sweet and moderate bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes quite dry and bitter possible with tannins from berries and definitely some lingering wooden smoke. Fine drinkability.
Slightly copper color with a thick off-white head. Aroma is malty and citrus notes of orange peel. Flavor is quite yeasty and fruity, slightly smoked. Medium body and carbonation sweet fruity finish.

BOTTLE 50CL from gunnar, Thanks a lot!

Look: clear copper body with a big light orange head.
Aroma: perfume, fruit or berries with a clear somewhat harsh dusty note, which is quite pleasant.
Taste: that hard to verbalize sweet bud dry body, light fruit or berries, with a somewhat harsh nordic character (juniper?), char/ashy (but not smoked or roasted) and bitter finish. Medium-bodied and very drinkable, just as the label says. Unique and very interesting!

Huge off white head, amber-golden body, clear, lacings.
Roasted malts and hops to the nose, some hay and flowers too.
Roasted malts, grainy hops under, ashy syrup and yeast to the tongue.
Alright on palate and suitable carbonation.
Slightly mealy finish with the dark ashy malts and some spices.
Seems to be more as brown scottish ale than traditional ale, and I assume
that beers for harvest may have had less alcohol.

Bière dune couleur cuivrée, voilée, qui est coiffée dune généreuse mousse qui prend beaucoup de place avant de se résorber, sans laisser de traces. Un nez fruité, herbacé, épicé malté et sucré. Gorgeous cloudy very dark golden pour topped by a dense, small-bubbled, meringue-like white head which remains thick and firm as sips go by. Another lovely and fairly unique ale from Haandbryggeriet. Has a garden quality to it (herbs, spices, green character, earthy, vegetal, tea leaves, flowers...) that reminds me of Terre Ferme from à lAbri de la Tempête, but this is a far maltier, relatively thick for its strenght ale with a leathery, smoked ham smokiness that is not subtle, yet does not dominate at all. Surprisingly, there is a lot of bubble activity in there, but those valliant bubbles are all soft and uniform, never giving a biting impression, rather cleansing up the palate between sips and cutting any hints at sugariness. Yet it does not feel all that dry either thanks to its chewy side. I find it impressive when I encounter a beer I find both quite thick and not very sweet at all. Akin to a very good multi-grain dense bread which feels nourishing in its multi-dimensional malt profile, but that you can easily eat several slices of without tiring yourself. A bit weird on the yeast profile which has a phenolic side that I dont find fitting with all the rest thats already going on. A zesty lemony/orangey hop bite concludes it all nicely. Unique and very satisfying.

Flavor:cereal,grany and honey....

Bottled, from Vinmonopet Stjördal.  Cloudy amber, small head. Salty and sweat, some funk. Medium bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Ripe fruits, hay and rye bread. Long bitter finish.Relaxed and pleasant.
Om nom nom. Haandbryggeriet, marry me. A great copper beer with a wonderful yeasty body with notes of roasted malt.
Draft. Amber colour. Malty, nutty and smoky. Very nice beer.

Botella de 500ml. Copa de Vino. Saboreada en jul´12. Color ámbar anaranjado y apariencia algo cristalina. Corona blanca y fugaz- En nariz. Trazos de malta caramelo moderadamente tostadas, aromas florales y sutiles maltas ahumadas. Sabor de malta cristal y toque amargo y afrutado seguido de notas de bacón ahumado. Cuerpo medio/ligero y carbonatación media/alta. Sensación picante en el paladar. Textura oleosa levemente aguada. Final seco y astringente.
500ml bottle. Wine glass. Enjoyed on jul´12. Orangish amber color, quite crystal clear appearance. Off-white, brief crown. Mildy toasted caramel malt hues, floral aromas & subtle peat malts to the nose. Crystal malt flavor, bitter & fruity touch followed by smoky bacon-like notes. Light to medium body, moderate to high carbonation. Spicy palate. Oily slightly watery texture. Dry astringent finish.

Bottle thanks to Palme!! Cheers buddy! Pours a slightly cloudy, orange beer with a beautifull, stable white head on top. Aromas of wheat, fresh coriander and some yeasty notes present as well. Flavours are wheaty, showing a nutty undertone and having a spicy, bitter aftertaste. Hops are present in the aftertaste as well, lot of grapefruits. Drank this chilled on a very hot night and it was thirst quenching and refreshing and so easy drinkable. Awesome suprise!

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber with a medium off-white head that lasts well and laces nicely. Aroma is malty with a bit of grain, some sweetness from honey, and grass. Taste is slightly sweet roasted malt, caramel, with a bit of grass and a slightly bitter finish. Full and rich in the mouth. This is a very interesting and complex beer. I like it.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks DSG. Pours orange with a medium head, aroma of sausage, wood and some floral hops, flavor is lightly smoked with some smoked fish, wood, spices and hops, moderate bitterness, medium to full bodied, nice
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange and a small white head. Aroma of flowers, smoke, wood, and some cherry. Flavour the same. Medium bodied. Ok.

On bottle from Batch 445
Golden color, ok foam .
Medium body & complexity.
Some smoke in flavours, as well as some hops( only some) which comes later. Sweetness in taste.
Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Tap at Barley Johns in New Brighton. Clear light gold pour with a white head. Aroma is bread, with some sour and medicinal elements. Palate is moderate. Taste is spice/pepper, fresh baked bread, and a hint of light fruit.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks KnutAlbert for this bottle! Hazy orange. Spicy-smoky aroma with a hint of acidity, a bit of hops, yeast and a bit of fruitiness. Sweetish flavor with malt, somewhat smoky, with light acidic notes, caramel, a bit of fruity notes, a bit of spicy notes and a bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Nice.

Clear medium orange-amber with 1/4" long-lasting white head and 1/2" solid lace above the brew.Dark fruit and malt give this a taste reminiscent of cough syrup.  Big flavor, some alcohol warmth, a solid brew for a chilly night.  Recommended.
This beer has a strong Nelson sauvin type hop taste to it. Very bitter but refreshing

50cl bottle. Little white head, bubbles on side of glass. Clear red-orange color. Good, lighter crisp carbonation, and drier texture. Interesting, toasty malt aroma, but still crisp and fresh tasting. Earthy hops. Good, light bitter taste. Some very light warmth, something hard to describe about the flavor. Tasty, interesting brew.

Aroma sumamente interesante. Intensamente aroma a cebada, ciertas notas tostadas, ligero caramelo y aromas herbales, y todo eso con notas finales ahumadas.
Referente a la apariencia, cerveza sumamente turbia, color amarillo opaco, carbonatación media, cuerpo medio y liquido espeso, corona de espuma abundante y duradero, muy esponjoso.
Al primer sorbo lo primero que llama la atención es la cremosidad sin duda debido a su espesa corona.  Se percibe un muy ligero amargor y sobresale el muy estructurado sabor de la cebada.
Al paladar,  se concretan los aromas percibidos ya que se perciben ligeramente aromas florales, sin embargo las notas ahumadas concentran la atención, sin llegar a ser desagradables y dando un sabor sumamente agradable.
En general sun cerveza fascinante, intensa, interesante y en la cual los aromas se hacen una realidad en el paladar. Ampliamente recomendable.

500ml bottle at home. Subtle aroma, yet a powerful and very tasty treat. Well balanced and a unique one of a kind beer. Fruity and black pepper notes, smokey and balanced, with a nice hoppy finish. Haandbryggeriet is turning on the style with this one.

27th March 2012Bottle in our quirky Oslo hotel. Cloudy amber beer, tidy white head. Light crispy palate, semi dry. A little farmhouse funk, saison character and a definite streak of smoke. Tangy malt with hop bitterness and  dried fruits. Semi dry finish with minerals. I can imagine this is how beers in Norway used to taste in days of yore. 100% support keeping the traditions alive but my modern palate is a bit puzzled by it. Quaffable though.

50 cl bottle @ home. Batch #293. Rated on 22.02.2011
Aroma has some smoke and ash. Flavour is slightly smoky with some roasted malt, ash and wood. The Haandbryggeriet house flavour is strong on this one. Good!

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 Fruity aroma, peach and floral, grass, hay. I hint of roasty taste, with a bitter finish. Light amber colour, with a small white head. A really good and refreshing ale, but a little too light bodied.

Bottle. Has a light amber colour with a small off-white head, slightly hazy. Fruity aromas along with peaches and other sweet fruits, and with a nice touch of smoke. The flavour is even more smokey, and with sweet fruits and grass. Slick mouthfeel and a medium bitterness. A really one of kind beer with a terrific smokey touch. An excellent harvest ale!

Very tasty beer, like all the beers from Haandbryggeriet. Lovely!

It tastes just as good as it looks!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy brownish amber with medium beige head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, yeasty bready notes, some dark fruit, dates, plums. Taste is sweet lightly toasted caramel malt, yeast, dark fruity flavors of plums and dates, lightly hopped. Palate is a medium body with a slightly thick texture, with some mild carbonation. Finish is sweet lightly toasted caramel malt, yeasty with some dark fruits of plums, raisins dates followed by some light hops bitterness to balance the sweetness. Overall a very good, tasty brew, very much enjoyed this.
On tap at Håndverkerstuene. Pours amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruits with hints of smoke and yeast. Sweet and malty taste, well balanced with hoppy bitterness.

Draft. Poured a clear dark orange color with a light tan head. Nice saison elements in the nose that included the likes of subdued lemon, hay/cereal grains, and spices. Smoke accents as well. Medium bodied and delicately sweet.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 Bottle at Atticus Finch. Very rich, and well balanced. Aromas of caramel, whisky, smoke, and citrus. Taste is sweet, with bitter notes, and very long length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Amber, with a frothy head.

On tap at "Parkteateret", in Oslo. Pours a very nice, fairly clear, red-ish brown colour. The head is quite small. The aroma is very pleasant. Its sweet bready malt, a little bit of sugar, but nothing too intense, and notably there is a smoked character that is slightly subdued as well. I mean its there but its not offensive, or boasting that this is a smoked beer. Its clean, slightly sweet malt, but not cloying, its quite crisp, but not dry, and the mouthfeel is right on medium. At first the smoked flavour isn’t very pronounced, but after a while it grows quite strongly and lingers in the finnish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500mL bottle, pours an opaque orange amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of light wood, light smoke (like around a campfire), some spices and bready malts. Flavour of smoked malt / campfire, wood, and bready malt. Medium-bodied, smoky and quite dry. Good.

Bottle and served in an Ommegang Anno Tulip: Nice amber hue with a fluffy white head and spotty lace. The aroma has notes of pine needles, earthy yeast esters, caramel, grainy pale malts, rye bread, heather, sea salt, tobacco, ashy smoke and some medicinal "band-aid" vapours. The taste is rather grainy with some light spice and herbal hop bitters. Sort of a Biere de Garde character with the yeast being the main characteristics here, followed by pale malts, rye bread and some crystal and lastly the noble herbal hops. What I do really like is the smoky finish that adds a layer of complexity I was not expecting.  The mouth feel is just to medicinal for me to rate higher than the base score of 3, a tad ashy and oily. Overall... well this is different but honestly not all that great. The parts are greater the whole, never seemed to mesh into one coherent brew.

A little ageing did not hurt this 500 ml. harvest ale.  Mild smoke aroma.  A bit of an overflowing foaming ale.  Rye, smoked wheat, edgy and more complexity and mouthfeel body than a smoked lager.  Good drinkability with food. Satisfying. On the bitter side without a lot of hops, yet not too bitter.
Bottled. Amber coloured. Hazy. Fluffy beige head. Herbs, Light smoke, bread, yeast and some caramel. Flavour of bacon, leather, smoke, caramel. Medium bodied. Ends Light meaty and smoked.

Pours a murky chestnut brown with thin off white head. Aroma is smoky malt, mild hops. Taste is bonfire smoky, like hickory infused, but with a decent hop bite. Almost smoky enough to be a rauchbier. Interestingly crisp though with a slight saltiness. Finish is bright with mild hops as the smoke lingers nicely mid tongue. Decent.

This is a kind of strange beer.  Smells like a fireplace and tastes a bit like a campfire.  Its got quite a bit of smoke.  You can taste rye and a bit of woodiness. None of these things make it sound that good, but its pretty well balanced with hops.  I like it.

Poured out a beautiful slightly burnt orange with a large off white bubbly cap that settled down into a thick and compact cover. Whoa! Sneaking a sip gave  me a blast of surprise. I had no idea this beer was killer smoky - I love beer surprises. I certainly cannot full that type of strength out of the aroma. Interesting aroma indeed: thick roast, minerally water, smouldering dry grass, some sort of potpourri mishmash of perfumy scents minus the lavender, some variant of caramel with a bit of earth. The fruitiness is apparently from produce brought from a distant planet - dont ask me how I know that or even how it gets here - just know that I tell the truth. Fascinating aroma. The flavours are equally interesting - what a wacky well put together beer. Somehow this is actually refreshing - Presario made me consider that after reading his review. I guess Presario could be a chick.... who knows really. I could be a chick! I did use the word "potpourri" in this review so far - what a mo! This beer has my panties in a bunch - so much going on.. whats a girl to do but take it all down the trap?  Tangy something, interesting brand of smoke - woody not grassy like I thought in the aroma, warmness, salt, I almost want to say peach but..., interesting how some sips have a very strong tang and in other sips I totally forget about it. The smoke gets more woody as I bottom the glass, stellar belch. Hell of a beer.

Bottle overflowed when I opened it, so I spilled a lot of it. Pours hazy amber with, due ti previous implications, a really large white head. Very interesting range of aromas that I havent encountered and have problems getting names to. Rye bitterness, some hops, but also a specific fruityness. Due to my lack of experience, I probably will rate this again in the future to be more specific. But I liked it!

Bottle at home, from my Hennepin glass. Pours hazy copper/brown; thin off-white head, ropey lacing. Nose is spicy noble hops, tropical fruit, tart rye-like spiciness: Even though this beer apparently constains no rye malt, Im really digging the rye-like notes in this one! Flavours of spice, smoke and tart yeast; some citrus (hops?) and banana notes as well. Very unique, and extremely nice.
Hazy golden with a huge, white head. Flowery and fruity notes. Malt, fruit and a "chemical" bitterness.Medium body with a very bitter finish.

Bottle. Dark amber, almost copper. Good head. Aroma is a full of grass and twigs, dead leaves and herbs. Flavour starts thin and a bit weird. Body seems to thicken and the overgown garden in your mouth comes to live with earth fall herbal flavours. A solid thirst quenching earthy ale.

This is a very unique brew that I find quite similar to Norwegian Wood. The pour is a bright amberish red with a thick beige head that dies instantly to a thin cap. Huge rings of sticky lacing are left on the glass as evidence of the once bountiful head. The nose is well malted with a pronounced earthy and woody note. A hint of unknown fruits and a nice forward hop. And interesting smoke note permeates this truly unique aroma. My first taste is sweet and malty with an earthy taste and a light smoke. Hints of unusual and unknown fruits and a bitter, dry finish. Prolonged bitterness and a lingering subtle woody smokiness. Hesjeol is a truly unique and interesting brew...not quite sure what it is???
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, light smoky and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 221211
Bottle. Clear dark amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruit and a little smoke. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, little smoke, caramel, hops and medium bitter.
Bottle Vinens Verden. Huge creamy head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are smoke, caramel, wood, malt, fruits and hops.

500ml brown bottle. Pours out deep golden-orange, with haze. Very tight beaded creamy white cap. Nose has a smooth, smoky malt notes up front, some caramel sweetness behind, no hops to be found. Taste has smokey, hickory wood notes, hint of salt, caramel malt sweetness, low bitterness. Body is medium and carbonation is smooth and even. Overall this was a nice mellow, easy drinking ale with pleasant smoke notes.

500ml bottle listed at 6.5%ABV pours a light brown color with a finger and a half of off-white head that settles leaving only a few specks of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is smoky malts with a bit of earthiness.  Taste is smoked malty bitterness with a light hop bitterness and some earthy notes in the finish.  Nicely balanced flavors with a medium body and good carbonation.  This is a very nice ale that I truly recommend anyone to try.

Hazy brown, huge beige head. Smells like roasted chestnuts plus a little bit of spice - cinnamon, mostly. Flavor is spicy, nutty, and a little bit boozy. As it warms, I get some bourbon, vanilla, and some woody flavors, too.

Bottle:   Hazy amber, slight sediment floats about, head is moderate, off-white, leaving spotty lacing. 

  Campfire, peat, smoked malts on the nose.   Smells very inviting!   Reminds me of a softer Hair of the 

Dog Adam.   Spritzy on the tongue, smokey, malty, peaty... this is a treat!   Very smooth, clean, with a good 

malt background.   Charred wood, peat, slight sweat, and smoked malts remain from start to finish, and linger for 

quite some time.   Did I mention smooth?   A little bubbley on the tongue.   Has a slight sweet aspect to 

it.   Lends itself well to this one.   This one has so much depth, I find myself wanting to reach for 

another... but I do not have any other bottles.   Thats rare for me to say for this style.   Great stuff! 

  The flavors just keep on keeping on.   Great beer!

Bottle.Batch 355, Brygget 08.04.11, Best för 08.04.13. Slightly hazy dark brownish orange amber with a medium, large-bubbled, off-white head. Aroma is fruity, slightly smokey and yeasty. Taste is somewhat sweet. Caramel, tones of smoke and yeast, some floweriness and herbs as well as grain, tones of Belgian fruits. Aftertaste is cereal, herbal and pine, you can sense some slight tones of passion fruit as well. Palate is pretty full and somewhat carbonated.
UPDATED: FEB 29, 2012 Bottle. Hazy amber colour with a beige head. Light fruity and light smoked aroma. Caramel and roasted barley flavour.
A clear amber colored beer, with a thick foamy beige head. The aroma caramel malts with fruits. The taste of caramel spices with bitter hops. The aftertaste is some sweet with bitter and some spices.

50 cl bottle thanks to tkrjukoff. Sampled on October 28, 2011Batch 355, marked 6.5% ABV, BB 08.04.13Murky orange color, yeast bits, yellow head. Sweet, elderberry flower scent. Sweet, fruity, alcohol taste. Elderflower aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, dry medium bitterness. Warming alcohol.
Bottle (50 cl), courtesy of tkrjukoff. Shady amber, medium off-white head. Strong phenolic aroma with notes of rubber and smoke. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with harsh bitterness.
Bottle, thanks to tkrjukoff. Golden beer with a nice beige head. Floral fruity aroma. Hoppy floral flavor, grassy, fruity, some perfume, some citrus.
Draft. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Light smokey and grainy aroma. The flavor is lightly smokey and toasty, with grains and a light sweetness. Nice.

Pours cloudy amber with a nice creamy beige head leaving lace. Aroma is hay, smokey, malty, phenolic. Flavor is bitter, malty, a bit smokey, phenolic, pungent and a bit peppery. Finishes longlived bitter.

Sample at Ale Wine & Spirits in Powell on 10/14/2011. Pours a clear copper color with a thin white head that diminishes steadily to an outer ring. Stringy lacing on the glass. Mildly smokey aroma with notes of malt and spice. Medium body with a subtle smoke character and flavors of caramel malt, herbs and earth. The finish is malty with a smoked aftertaste. Interesting, above average beer overall.

On tap at Rattle n Hum.  Pours a somewhat hazed amber gold with a medium sized creamy white head.  Floral on the nose, heather and lemon peel.  Very faint hint of smoke shows up on the nose as it warms. Medium bodied, a delicate smoke note comes through right away, transitioning into more floral heather, paired with a soft caramel malt sweetness.  Finishes a touch on the malty sweet side, but not overbearing in any way.  Soft bitterness follows, but very delicate.  Nice, and quite interesting.
Draught, 7%. Vinous aroma. Cloudy grey orange colour. Small white head. The flavour starts off quite malty, turning alcoholic. Rather late mild smoke note with a hint of fruit to balance the alcohol.

Bottle. Pours hazy brownish orange with a short frothy white head that doesnt last long. Aroma is quite malty and a little woody with hints of apple and orange. Flavour is still malty and woody but not so fruity, with additional grass and mineral notes. Light, slightly oily mouthfeel with plenty of lively carbonation and a lingering bitter finish. Not too bad for an old fashioned style such as this, but not the sort of thing I would want to drink all the time.
Draught from R&H.  Poured a lighter shade of amber brown, aroma is mostly wood & smoke but kind of a lighter wood, cedar maybe. taste is same.  V. Good.
50 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy orange with a nice head. Aroma: Dominant smoke, malt, hops. Taste: Some bitterness and sweetness, salt. Palate: Light-medium body, a bit thin. Light carbonation.

from Erzbierschof - cloudy red-amber beer with a firm and creamy beige foam; nice lace; a fair citrusy hoppiness with notes of caramel and mango; medium to full malt backbone, a subtle carbonation and a velvety palate, a moderate bitterness with a long aftertaste of caramel and flowery, fruity notes - very good

Smell of malt and toasted bread. Amber, almost orange colour. Light-brown, small, lasting head. Sharp palate. Aroma of alcohol, yeast and a faint of marshmallow when fridge cold. Gets fruitier with higher temperature. Alcohol is persistent the entire time, adding sweetness when warmer. Bitterness coming up also with temperature. Although quite good, theres something that feels being missing. Not certain what that could be, though.

Very interesting good beer. Let the bottle warm a bit out of the fridge. Poured with a foamy, fluffy, frothy, billowy, clumpy, cream colored head and lots of lace. Color is a clear medium dark amber with some bubble trails as they should be. Aroma is yeast, toffee, malt, dark riper fruit, and a hint of sm oke. Flavor is similar but smoke is much more prominant, followed by a sweet tang that really works to balance the whold. Finish is like flavor and has a long duration. Bit boozy there at the end too. Session if youre in the mood for this kind of thing. I rarely am.
Pours brown, pale. Medium white head. Smoke, hay and yeast aroma. Refreshing, but not super.

Batch is from 2009 but still seems to be fine. Pours a hazy copper color with a small white head. Aromas of spices, smoke and a little floral hop presence. Flavors of molasses, caramel, spices and smoke with a slight alcohol warmth. Kind of a creamy body with a bitter finish. Overall this is an interesting beer but I wish I had a fresher example.

50 cl, batch 265, bottled 24.03.10. Clear copper with a lasting head that leaves behind a sugary coating. Aromas of spicy citrus, caramel, and earthy wood smoke. Taste is beech smoke, wheat, citrus, light molasses and a hint of menthol. Light-medium body has too much carbonation, but is well-balanced and has a bit of alcohol warmth.

Bottle from bunker beer.
clear brown, large smooth beige head.
bitter caramelly, malty and slightly floral aroma.bitter caramelly spicyness dominates. flowery notes from hops can be sensed, as well as sweet caramelly and sweet matly notes.
Flavor is sweet caramelly, bitter, spicy, too sweet and spicy.
Bottle. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

50cL bottle.  Batch: 254, Bottled: 29.11.09.  Total bottles:2160.

Burnt orange color.  Aroma of smoked malts, autumn leaves.  Flavor of smoke and earth.  Nice caramel malts, and herbal spice.  

7,4,7,3,14
Hazy light red, dark orange color. Slight white head. Nice fruity light hoppy smell. Lightly dry finish and a fruity soft taste. Low to medium carbo.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a huge orangey head. The aroma has notes of citrus fruits and malt as well as lighter notes of hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel as well as lighter notes of hops, leading to a dry finish. The body is light.
A deep golden color, malty aroma with herbal and alcohol undertones, the herbal and alcohol elements play a role in the flavor. A solid golden ale all around, refreshing if you are having 3 or less.

500 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Pours a clear copper color with a small bubbly white head.  The nose is mildly smoky, herbal with hints of cooked vegetables.  The flavor had a touch more smoke than the nose, herbal hops, mild caramel and wood.  This was not what I was expecting.  Not really my thing, but worth trying once.

Thanks to heyta for sending this bottle out my way. Served in a tulip.

Gusher when opened at a cold temperature. Pours a slightly-murky orange-copper color with a thin white head that dissipates very quickly into a thin collar. The nose carries some light smoke and a bit of wood and spice. The flavor is fairly smoked with a bit of the woody character maintained. Not a strong smoke character, but there is a lot of the moderate smokeyness, if they makes sense. Overcarbonated and a light, fizzy body. Not a huge fan.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-16-2011
draft at Blue Monk. lighter amber pour. almost seems like Kwak with peat & smoke added. yeasty, caramel malts, medium herbalness, peat & smoke towards the finish. pretty flavorful & interesting beer

Large head carbonation mild to medium ochre coloured pour aroma fruity spicy woody honey sweetness flavour yeast wonderful sweet taste clove orange caramel classy bitter citrus tangy vibrant finish citrus yeast malt sweetness tangy ale lasting bitter

Pour copper brown beige head ridiculous lace. Aroma smoke, wood, malty, floral. Taste fruity, smokey, salty, floral, wood, malty. Mf medium body good carb refreshing. Overall excellent brew crisp easy drinking and yet tons of flovor.

6/1/11. 500mL bottle courtesy scotchzi! Hazy orange pour with a small tan head. Fruit and chocolate on the aroma with subtle smokiness as well. Sweet, malty flavor that transitions to a touch of smoke, then lemons and candy, and lingers herbal and dry. Interesting!

Im a fan of this spicy beer. Nutmeg, cinnamon and other bark-like essences, pine all are in the aroma and flavor profiles. Bitter, not very sweet, wonderful auburn hue with a lasting head and nice carbonation. Not over the top, a kind of moderately intense traditional spiced beer.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text:
There are some really clever guys working at Haandbryggeriet. The name of this beer, the label and the flavours all bring back memories from my childhood summers, that were spent on a tiny farm in southern Norway. The aroma is fruity and yeasty, with a sweet honey note. I didnt get many farm associations when smelling the beer, but the flavours are all barn, hay, earth from the newly dug potatoes and even some smoke from the burning of dead leaves and grass. The taste is initially moderate to light sweet followed by an amazing mix of moderate bitterness and a pronounced moderate sourness, very nice! The liquid is hazy, dark amber, with an average off-white head that rather quickly reduces to a thin layer that leaves a fair amount of lacing. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. A tasty and refreshing beer! So, anyone for putting hay on drying racks?
[50 cl bottle, batch 327, from Vinmonopolet, Grønland Basar, Oslo]

500ml bottle. Deep mahoganey colour with a red sheen to it. and a big full crown of sand coloured foam. Looks like a big solid beer. Strong caramel malt aromas that lure you in and prepare you for what is to follow. Flavour is malty and thick and coats the mouth with . Big, rich and strong.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a cloudy orange with a small white head. Great lacing. Aroma is full of citrus and sour funk. Some woody undertones in there as well. Dried biscuity malts and citrus come through in the flavour. A constant sour note in there which is nice. Good beer
Bottle. Pours an unclear amber, with a good, thick head. Nice citrusy aroma with notes of lemon and orange peel. A pleasant sour taste of hay, light fruit and citrus. Nice bitter finish.
Hazy amber brown colour with a medium sized head. Aroma is yeast, spices and some mild notes of fruits. Flavour is spices, leather, some wood and mild yeastyness.

Bottle. Pours a clear and dark amber beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, sweetness, notes of smoke and notes of caramel. The flavor is following the nose. The palate is sweetness. Overall an average beer.

Such a phenomenal brew. The aroma is outrageously awesome. Malty, smokey, yeasty. I love it. The pour is one of the most beautiful I have seen. Rich gold with a super creamy and thick head that stickes around the whole time. The glass is laces the whole time. The taste threw me for a loop at first. I couldnt believe the subtle smokiness. I really enjoyed it. It slightly dry, sweet but not too much and smokey/roasty. Its absolutely an amazing brew. I cant believe this one!

500ml bottle from Sams, Durham. Who doesnt want a beer like this after seeing the Thor movie? Pale, slightly cloudy amber pour with fairly minimal carbonation. Nose of gamey meat, smoke, sharp herbs, and fruit. Body is actually more abundant than the appearance would suggest, with a slight dose of heat on the palate. Raw, ripe, and youthful flavors for the most part, with juniper and sage and wet hops, at least so it seems, all framed by a modest but very present smoke. Idiosyncratic and enjoyable.

Smoke, wood, great aroma that also has some slight fruit and earth. The taste has a subtle smokiness that I havent encountered much, almost perfect. Even people who dont like smoked beers might like this. Palate is between normal and smooth, also gets better as it warms. Excellent.

500 ml bottle poured a cloudy orange amber with a lasting amber head. Aromas of bread, graininess, light carmel, light fruittiness and a hint of earthiness. Palate was medium bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread, toffee,light carmel, light smoke and a hint of fruittiness with a crisp smokey finish.

Bottle. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy brown head that was mostly lasting with fair lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt, cooked vegetables and smoke aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy earthy smoke sweet flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid complex beer.

Light amber, hazy beer. Thin but creamy head. Interesting, spicy and resiny  aroma with some sweet fruity notes, a hint of banana, caramel and smoky aftertaste. Dry, somewhat bitter finish with hints of dark berries. Medium to full body, velvety texture. Surprisingly drinkable for the strength and diversity of elements. Nice brew.

Complex fruity aroma as well as into the flavor.  Has a dry edge to it that flavor-wise I cant quite place what it tastes similar to.  Very interesting and hard to categorize a modern style that it is similar to, despite some IPA characteristics.

Cloudy, golden beer with a nice white foam crown. Apricot, smoke, malt, cereals, candy and spice rack in the aroma. A slight smoke and dried fruits dominates the taste - and perhaps a touch of wood? A unique beer with a surprisingly dry finish.
Slightly hazy amber with a big off-white head. Malty aroma with a hint of herbs and a bit of meaty smoke. Sweet malty flavour with a touch of caramel and both meaty and campfire smoke character

The liquid is of an amber/yellow/orange/rusty colour, hazy and home-made apple juice like. The head has a very good texture with a creamy and silky appearance and keeps this texture very well for a long while. looks very nice to what youd expect. the aroma is full of fruit and has a herby/spicy side to it. reminds me of some IPAs, has some of the same qualities than the haand dobbel dose IPA. the taste has gentle bitterness and a very distinctive sweetness with a syrup/honey twist. a mild sourness deepens the taste very nicely. the beer itself is very refreshing indeed with a medium body that is easy to drink. what was interesting, is that the beer was exactly what I expected. this might be the reason I was left waiting for something more, but then again, this was great. good job.

500ml Bottle - Amber with a slight haze and a foamy head. Slightly musty aroma with hints of peach, biscuity malt and sultanas. Sweet and fruity taste with peach, apricot and sultanas detected. Nicely balanced and delicious. Im not sure what i was expecting, but this is really enjoyable.
Pours copper with a white head. Aroma is malt, perfume, peach and light smoke. Flavour is malt, perfume, grass, peach and earthy hop notes.

Bottle. Hazy dark red-orange, medium golden head. Aroma is initially is like outdoors in autumn, dried leaves and smoke. In short: A strange herbaceous ale.  Hard to rate
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed soon after purchase but this was about 8 months after bottling date.  I dont expect to drinking mega-fresh Norwegian beers in North-America
The look: Clear dark golden body topped by a medium beige head
In long: Nose has a strong and strange floral/perfumed character.  Taste is equally off.  Harvest ales are a strange bunch, and this one is one the strangest of them all.  Some juniper berries, fresh green pine needles, red apples, spices, tea, glazed cinnamon bun, herbs.  Not sure what else to add, I seem to be picking up strange unrelated flavors in this one.  After a full bottle I still didnt if I liked it or not, so Im giving it my just ok rate of 3.0.  Funny thing is I found this beer in a case I brought back with me from a little road trip and I have no memory ever buying this.  Maybe I have a bad memory.  Or maybe I have a secret life and I dont know about it because its good at what it does.

Speckled rusty-orange. Persistent off-white head. Polished yet equally rustic aroma of plum flesh and Juicy Fruit gum intertwined with biscuits, minerals, conifer tips/clove, hay dust, black pepper, dusty yeast, earthy malt, plaster, oats and smoke. Robustly phenolic as well, with sharp underlying notes of iron and fennel. Bottle-conditioned carbonation provides dense carbonation and a soft caress. Opens very delicately with a flawlessly balanced medley of smoked bread and palate-hugging haylike malt textures. Rustic notes are never far behind as the dusty yeast clings to the malt and raspy smoke while the crackling phenols provide balance. Succulent surge of fresh plum contributes ample brightness and depth to the core while sharp but clean alcohol augments the black-pepper snap and lightens the body by displacing some of the residual sugars. All the while the deep-seated malt remains steadfast in its immovable, albeit squeaky-clean, girth. A finishing flourish of alcohol and conifer tips yields faint astringency at the finish, though creamed coffee and assertive tobacco soften it nicely. Aside from the alcohol, which deadens some brightness and subtleties, this is quite good. Would love to see the alcohol brought down to around 5%.
