Copper color with a medium head.  Perfumy aroma with cloves.  Moderately smokey taste.  Light malt and spice notes.

Bottle 50 cl. Orange, hazy with a nice frothy offwhite(orange) head. Aroma; fruity and some spices with sence of yeast. Flavor; wow, smoke with a fruity sence. Medium bitter endig with a aftertaste that says smoke...

0.5 l bottle at Salhojankadun pub, Tampere. Hazy amber color. Sweetish, tart, piney and woody aroma. Sweetish flavor with  bready-toffeish maltiness, tart woody juniper and pine as well as hints of menthol. Firm taste but not very drinkable. The flavor is slightly yeasty.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head.  Earthy, spices, and light smoke and chocolate malt, almost saison like. Crisp flavor with a smooth finish.

20100613  50cl bottle from State Line. Batch 254, bottle 20091129.  Brilliant, hazed, nearly ruby copper color with lasting khaki froth, soft and pillowy.  Gorgeous beer.  Aroma is initially faintly smoky, like green hardwoods and some spruce on a campfire, but with temp and time Im also finding a good bit of juniper, peat, cherry stems, leather, and a dash of pleather or shoe polish.  The body is medium and soft with easy, natural eff becoming more aggressive as it rests on the palate.  Again, first flavor impression is of light smoke, this time a bit more prominent, and then an array of woods and weeds in a delicious tea of organic flavors.  Never even a tiny bit sweet, but full and malty with light bitterness and slight brine.  Its no secret that these sorts of traditional beers, all herby and spicy and whatnot, are really appealing to me, and this one is no exception.  Darn you Scandinavians for making your delicious treats so expensive!

Bottle from Frank Smiths.  Pours chill hazy deep cppery w 3f ow head and great lacing.  Nose is c malt, spicy, resiny hops, perfumy.  Tastes crisp, very resiny, hoppy, floral, spicy.  Medium palate heft, with big complexity.  This one is great.
Fløska. Nice hazy golden oarnge colour with a big white head. Pleasant fruity sweet hoppy aroma. Good mouthfeel indeed. Pleasant fruity hoppy piney flavour, caramel, good bitterness.

pours an amber/golden color...slightly hazy with orange hues.  looks like iced tea...huge foamy white head.  great retention.  has an earhy/wheaty aroma with some spice to it...faint cinnamon.  also some citrus and bubblegum.  flavor is very wheaty but with more hop flavor than a tradtional wheat beer.  subtle hint of leather and funk...any bret scottie?  mouthfeel is slightly heavy and oily but lively.  lingering earthy finish.  interestingly complex beer.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2010 batch 254. unfiltered bronze brown.  malt sweetness and chewiness in the vein of munich/caramel/vienna; bright and juicy hops but also seems dried and powdery; light touch of smoked malt or toasted wood.  hearty and chewy, perfectly presented by the carbonation.  light toasted and smoked banana peel and pear at times in the lengthy finish. light ethanol and possible light fusels in the nose when warmed.  quite rustic and enjoyable though there is a noticeable banana ester that becomes more unpleasant as it opens up and warms.

Bottle.  Pours hazy orange with a large, creamy/frothy off-white head, mostly lasting with excellent lacing.  Aroma is average malt (cookie, straw, meal), average hops (perfume, herbs), average yeast (earth) with notes of wood and smoke.  Full bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation and a bitter finish.  Long duration, moderate sweetness and bitterness, light acidity.

Bottle (50cl) from Vinmonopolet, Oslo. Batch 254 (BB 11.11.2011). Slightly hazy, reddish amber colour. Inch-thick offwhite head, reducing to a persistent film. Nose is reminiscent of an abbey tripel (ripe fruit, apricot, banana, butter, alcohol) and also pine. In the mouth theres also a rustic, smokey (whisky-like) element. Medium body, medium carbonation. Well-balanced. Aftertaste has a lot of hop bitterness and whisky sweetness. Very interesting and highly enjoyable. (Bottled version better than tap version at Olympen, Oslo, possibly due to the latter being served too cold).

(500ml bottle batch 254 bottles 11-29-09 thanks to bu11zeye) cloudy orange with light lasting bubbles and excellent lacing. Nose of rye, juniper, spices, smoky wood and herbal. Taste of smoke, juniper herbal, and wood. Smoky, oily finish. Enjoyable.

This is a subtle ale. Pours a hazy brown. Its got a nice maltiness with just a hint of smokiness--more bitter coffee than smoke. The body is on the light side for me; I like the subtle flavors but would like a little more body.

Bottle (Nov 29, 2009 bottling).

Head is initially average size, fizzy/frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is medium amber, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly hoppy (herbs, flowers), lightly yeasty (cobwebs, barnyard), with notes of smoke, spruce/juniper needles, mint, light notes of wood and band-aid.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic.

Fun little beer...not super exciting, but quite pleasant.  It makes me think of Norwegian Wood a bit, but this is less smoke-accented and more...hmmm...rustic. The sweetness isnt that strong, but it does tend to stick around well into the finish.  Solid.

Draft at Long Room. Pours a darkish hazy amber. Nose is phenolic smoke and a Belgiany yeast character. Taste is pretty rustic with strong smoke notes, roasty malt and again more of the Belgian yeast character. A bit off putting and a shame after Norwegian wood. Interesting at least.
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye,  pours an orange  amber color with a soapy  white foam. aroma of honey, herbs and smoke,  flavor of smoke, caramel, tropical fruit and musty herbs

(500ml bottle, Batch 254 (2160 bottles), bottled 29.11.09)  Pours a hazy amber body with a medium white head.  Aroma of juniper, toasted rye, and honeycomb.  Flavor of smoke (burning grass), juniper, caramel, pine, earth, and toasted rye.

Pours hazy brownish gold with a very small head that dissapates quite fast. Nose is smoky, bacony, with a distinct wheat overtone. Taste is smoky, with a great banana, wheat, character. Very rounded, with a dry finish,. Thirst quenching, complex, not too light nor too heavy. Fairly complex. I really enjoy this beer and it seems like a style onto its own.
Pours cloudy caramel color with tan head. Bready and earthy aroma. Wheat flavor with some spices, dough and mustiness. A touch of smoke.  Light to medium body with lively carbonation

Thanks to AJ for sharing.  Pours a copper color with a thin white head.  Aroma spices,  earthiness, and herb.  Unique flavor with cardamon the dominant spice, some earthiness, and citrus.  Nice dry finish.

Bottle shared with Philipp, Nico & Felix.  Cloudy orange, medium off white head, great lacing.  Aroma of orange peel, cardamon, yeast.  Good body, taste is very malty, cinnamon, nutmeg.  Slight smoky edge.  Nice bitter finish.  Good one.
Bottle split with dallas at Belgian cafe. Pours a hazy amber body with sediment and nice white lacing. Aroma is strange, a bit meaty - maybe some Bacon.
Slightly hazy pour. Meaty smell to the nose. Tastes of smoked spices reminiscent of a christmas ale. Very interesting.
Hazy light amber with flowery hop and smoke aroma - tastes of malt , hops and olso some smoke ,- some yeast in the background, - smoke bitterness and some hop continues into a dry finish - ok beer

500ml bottle, batch #254.  Bottled on 11/29/2009 and consumed 4/13/2010.  The pour yields a slightly hazy, dark and dusky, orange to sienna amber colored body.  A moderate head of dense, spongy, beige tinted foam is slow to recede, eventually forming a thin but lasting blanket with a solid rim.  Sudsy, spotty lacing mostly rejoins the body below.  The nose is quite unique, showing notes of smoke and earth amidst hints of green peas and days-old arugula, with a bevy of twiggy spice notes and an underlying base of caramelized and blonde sugars.  Flavors feature a faded, grassy hoppiness and notes of withered tea leaves, with a resounding smokiness and a slight caramel sweetness.  Theres definitely a canned English pea component that some hate, but I dont mind one bit.  The palate is bigger than its 7% ABV would suggest, showing smooth but slightly sticky at the mid point, and finishing slightly dry.  Overall, a very interesting and quite drinkable brew.

Bottle 500ml.Clear medium amber orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, smoke - rubber - plastic, light roasted and caramel, light hoppy, light yeast. Flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to light light heavy bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100320]

Quite an interesting brew - sort of like a gruit  - the aroma and flavor are a hodgepodge of complex, earthy herbs and spices - it tastes like they took a huge bundle of them (rosemary, mint, thyme, ginger, peppercorns, yarrow), smoked them over peat, and tossed the in the brew - my only complaint is that it is a little thin, and a bit too sweet to sustain the complex spice profile - reminds me of 16th Century Grut, but not as well-executed - still, a nice change of pace, which is what I usually expect from this brewery.

Flaske: Flot orange let uklar øl med et fint tæt skumhoved. God solid maltduft med et ordentligt indspark fra røgmalten. Smagen er igen meget røget, men stadig med en friskhed og en mangel på bacon man normalt ville finde i en røgøl. Virkelig en dejlig øl.

Name: Hesjeol
Date: March 04, 2010
Mode: Bottle
Source: Charleston Beer Exchange
Appearance: cloudy burnt orange, fine grey head, streaks of lace
Aroma: sweet and spicy aroma with a smokey overtone
Flavor: sweet malt flavor, lots of earthyness mixed with a smokey character
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4
This beer was very surprising considering I didnt know what to expect.  It is a meaty beer, with notes of salmon; Heavy grain; very earthy and full.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear amber with a dense off-white head. Rather perfumy, spice nose with a whiff of smoke. Solid body, very smooth and soft mouthfeel, rather sweet caramel and fruit - again with a smoky edge. Some hops in the finish. Quite interesting. 200310

Pours light brown with a creamy head. Aroma-smoky, herbal, earthy, malty. Taste-smoke, sweet malts, a bit of herbal bitterness in the finish. Like camping in the woods. Very complex. Smooth and full bodied. Batch 254.

Batch 254, bottled 11/29/09.  Without disturbing the sediment from the bottom this ale poured brilliant and amber with a small tan head.  Faint malt aroma.  In flavor, malt forward, slightly sweet, mildly bitter smokiness, with earthy peat.  With just a touch more hops and this would be perfect.  Very good.
Bottle. Amber color. Very earthy aroma with leaves, pieces of wood and earth, like in a forest. Malty sweet, earthy caramelly flavor with woody notes and juniper. Tasty brew.

Bottle.  Pours a rustic amber brown body with a creamy off white head.  Spiced grains, a light ginger pepper peat hybrid.  Earth driven grains and light campfire.  Spicy malt with a light chocolate and mineral tone, spicy with ash char and peat.  LOVE IT.
Bright amber pour with a fluffy off white head.   Aroma is fruity and earthy.  Flavor surprisingly complex fruit, straw, earthiness, grass, and light spruce.  Slick finish

Bottle. Amber beer with a dark cream colored head. Earth and spice aroma with light grass. Earth and spice flavor with light cocoa and herbal notes. medium bodied. Herbal qualities linger with earth, spice, and light malt.

50cl bottle. Batch 254, Total Bottles: 2160, Bottled: 29.11.09. Poured a medium and slightly hazy amber color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of fruitiness, bananas in the background, cloves, some breadiness, and floral. Tastes of the same fruitiness, spices, a little earthy, and grains.

Bottle at home.
Hazy orange coloured with sediment and a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, hops and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of caramel, hops and pine needles with notes of brett.
Hoppy finish.

Bottle from Bierkoning. Dark brown murky body with lasting head. Grainy and dark grape nose. Taste malty, caramel and then become more medicinal and spicy. Finishes sweet, mostly. Texture is quite smooth and syrupy. Interesting.
Medium brown with no head.  Honey, grain, malt, grape, and floral smokey aroma.  Smokey and woody flavors with a burnt earthy finish.

bottle.  batch 254.  bottled 11/29/09.  hazy reddish orange under a large, foamy, off-white head.  sweet and fruity aroma.  lively and bouquet like.  a very fruity beer with soft pears, apples, peaches and assorted flowers.  a long lasting fluffy head.  nice creamy medium body.  a privilege to taste  a heartland norwegian beer.

Bottle Cloudy deep amber ale with an orange tint and a mid-sized, creamy, off-white head. Fantastic retention. Bready aroma with a lot of clove. Full-bodied with modest carbonation. Well-balanced, spicy flavor. Short, crisp, clean finish.

Bottle, Batch 254, home.  This beer pours a tawny shade of sienna with a small beige-ish head.  The aroma is big mix of caramel malt, spicy rye, smoke, oak and floral hops.  Theres also what I now recognize as a wild yeast note from Haands own strain.  The flavor is medium sweet, smoke and more of that interesting yeast.  This is another very good beer from an excellent brewery.
Pours a hazy light amber color with a thin white head.  Mild spices and grain on the aroma.  Thick mouthfeel, mild sweetness with a slight touch of a sour grain character.  Not bad.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette.Unclear amber/broan - offwhite head.  Nice hoppy, grassy, pepper, light toasted, perfumed, fruity, nice bitterness, light smokes notes. Nice.

Bottle. Low and qucikly disappearing fluffy white head. Clear light brown to amber body. Fruity hoppy grassy aroma. Pretty hoppy acidic fruity flavor with low carbonation and a long bitter aftertaste.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, fruity hops, grain, slight smoke, and hints of fruit and spice.  Poured amber/copper in color with a medium-sized, creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Lightly sparkling.  Full of small particles throughout.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, smoke, light wood, hops, slight spice, light smoked cheese, and some grain.  Medium body.  Lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, smoke, wood, hop, and grain finish is lightly dry.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2011 50cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Batch 254. Brewed 2009-09-11. Best before 2011-11-11. It poured an orange colour with a medium big foamy head. A small bit of carbonation. The aroma is very good. Fruity, malts, some yeast  and smokiness. The smoke was a bit of a suprise, but its not in the way. The flavour has a noticable smokey touch compared to the aroma. Some hops and citrus fruits as well. A medium long aftertaste. I was a bit skeptical to seeing a harvest ale made available in january, but this is a very nice and refreshing beer that should be served chilled, but not close to freezing as some lagers.

Updated 2011-05-13. On tap at Cafe Laundromat. The smokey notes is still present, but even more subtle than before.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2010 Batch 254, bottled 11.29.09.  Pours a hazed, probably from cold, glowing darker orange amber with a medium frothy off-white foamy head.  Aroma is nicely citrusy, soapy grapefruit, soapy cedar, bright aroma with nice notes but a blanketing soapiness.  Flavor is at first bacon, the soapy, then sweet pineapple and green pine needles, again bacon in the finish with lasting soap.  Medium bitterness, sweet sharp caramel, bacon/smoke, green pine,brown sugar, pineapple, just a hint floral, touch of tropical fruits other than pineapple, but overall seems soapy (no its not my glass), plastic. Great lively sharp fizzy carbonation, medium bodied.  An extremely well made beer, love the depth of flavors and the body/carbonation is near perfect.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 Big offwhite coarseish head. Hazy reddish amber body. Light grainy strawy aroma with peppery fruity notes. Harmonic. Dry-sweet peppery funky strawy fruity taste, very harmonic, and hard to analyze, with caramelly roasty notes. Sharpish mouthfeel. Mid-bodied. Dry, and faintly acidic, wooden malty strawy aftertaste. Very unusual, but nice, and highly drinkable. (0.5l bottle, wine monopoly. Batch #254. Updated after drinking about twenty of these, to raise the score. Lovely session beer.)

500ml bottle picked up at Greens.

Pours a deep, clear amber, extremely lively, with bubbles feeding a three inch creamy white head that shows excellent retention.  There is solid lacing on the way down.

The aroma is interesting, caramel sweetness with a lightly smoked character.  There are some spices and herbs, maybe juniper, and sweet fruits and hops.

The taste has an earthy hop kick up front with some sweet berries and apricots on a more heavily smoked malt backbone than the aroma suggest.  The finish has some sweetness and hops but its the interesting hickory smoked flavor that lingers on the palate after each sip.

The mouthfeel is medium bodied and moderately carbonated which seems to balance the smokiness very well.

Im highly impressed with this one honestly.  Its very drinkable and has just the right amount of smoke to allow all the other flavors come out.  Really tasty.
Pours a reddish brown with a quickly dissipating head. Strange bitter aroma of tree bark and herbs. Truly strange! Smooth malt taste that has a big herbal not and strange bitterness. Cool stuff!!

500ml bottle, batch 240, from Vinmonopolet Tromsø Langnes, Pale ruby amber in body colour. Off-white head reduced to a patchy surface. Aromatic citrus hops to the nose with integrated sweet malts mingled by some spicy notes. Late, sweet fruits in flavour added by smoky malts and oily hops. Fairly straight bitter ending, but not quite enough to balance the sweetness. Medium bodied and rather easy to drink (Tromsø, 29.01.2010).

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2010 0,5 l bottle from Vinmonopolet, cooled to about 10 degrees celcius, left to "relax" for 6 hours after buying. Pours a hazy medium brown beer. Taste and smell (and name) associates heavily towards wood, pine, hay, citrus and herbs. 

Full and rich, yet surprisingly refreshing! A lot of citrus-y aroma, both in the taste itself and in the well-balanced aftertaste.

Sweet, with a clearly defined bitterness around the edges.
Update 2010-09-11 - batch 286, brewed 2010-05-11, BB 2012-05-11. Beautiful nose, fills the room with strawberries. The aroma is sweet with a nice hint of malt, and a very very fruity aftertaste, red berries marching forward to take the stand. Sweet mama, oh yes. Less wood and pine this time, more berry sweetness. And good golly miss molly, this is just wonderful. Some woody earthy pine-ish aromas on the edges still, but tonight its the red berry strawberry-malt which makes me go mmmm! Letting it linger brings out a longlasting fruity malt aroma which is great. At the same time its a lot of citrus and spicy freshness here, which makes this a really well balanced, beautiful brew! I wouldnt mind using this as a thirst quencher!

 HB seems to have sorted out their carbonization problem as well, because this one is just as sparkly as I like it. I dont know if this is what a traditional norwegian farm ale tasted like, but the taste sure takes my imagination towards places like this: </br> http://www.flickr.com/photos/alanjaras/84482690/
 />edit 2010-09-22: I had entered completely wrong on overall (4!) - now its corrected (17)!

Flaske 0,5l fra Vinmonopolet. Gyldenbrun på farge. Høyt kraftig skum som varer lenge. Litt uklart. Rik syrlig aroma. Smaken er syrlig & fruktig. Smaken varer og avsluttes svakt bittert. Litt fjøspreg. Et gjennomført godt øl. Forfriskende. Smaken er nok historisk - men tviler på at styrken er historisk korrekt. Da hadde nok slåttekarene ligget strøket mellom hesjene utpå dagen.

Hazy orange with tanned film. Aroma of sweat, barnyard, smoke and cloudberry wine. Sweet and pine bitter. Smoky finish. Smooth to drink. Medium body. 
Tap sampled @ Olympen 13.1. and @ Cardinal 20.1.2010. Best @ Cardinal where it was served a bit cooler.

Bottle. An unclear, golden-orange beer with a small, firm beige head. Some lacings. I wasnt expecting the smoke in the aroma, but shouldve known better. Its very cleverly done, leaving room for malty aromas and fruityness. Theres also a good citrusy, peachy and light resiny scent from the hops. The flavor has a faint raw bacon touch, but its mostly a pleasant smoked malt flavor with a wise use of hops. Not too sweet, not too bitter, and then theres the smoked twist. Full-bodied, refreshing and quenching at the same time. The finish has a fine bitterness, and all the initial flavors are still there. A beer that needs to be chilled or at cellar temp to be thoroughly enjoyed, not ice cold, as that wont reveal what it has to offer. Will definately have to buy more of this one. 100126
500ml bottle. Dark orange colored body with firm off-white head. Floral malty with traces of roasted malt for both taste and aroma. Plenty of hoops in aroma as well. Nice bitter aftertaste.

500 ml bottle . Batch 254. Pours deep hazy dark orange with a big frothy tan head. Aroma of yeasty malt, apricots and dark sugar. Taste is sweet, but dark in a nice way, like dark chocolate caramel, nice bitter towards the end, i have never tasted anything like this, but its good, with its own character.

Bottle. Cloudy orange with a medium head. Hints of smoked malts in the nose as well as fruity hops. In the mouth smokiness is quite prevalent, but good hop bitterness and fruit makes it quite refreshing. Fizzy. Original.

500 ml bottle. Dark golden to orange body with a fine, big, stable off-white head. Aroma is quite mild but very nice, some caramel/toffee, fruity like oranges, a little hint of honey and a pleasant acidic hint. Flavor is fruity like peaches, some caramel, a hint of honey, nice balanced bitterness  and a smooth fruity acidity in the finish. Medium body and an almost extreme quaffability factor here. This is a fine beer for refreshing with enough flavors to suit a few lighter dishes, well done again!

Its very nice to have Haandbryggeriet come up with a refreshing concept such as this one, since their performance has been varying a lot over the years in my opinion. This one delivers what it promises: an original, hoppy, floral, heystack-ish in-your-face-beer that really makes you feel as if you were just getting a break from the harsh harvest work on a traditional Norwegian farm. Not quite like any other beer out there, Hesjeøl gains quite a few points on originality despite the fact that Id probably not be very inclined to drink more than one bottle at any given time due - also due to its somewhat peculiar flavor. Nevertheless: thumbs up for Haandbryggeriet this time.

500 ml bottle, batch #240, from Vinmonopolet. ABV is 6.5%. Light brown hazy colour, big off-white head. Lovely aroma of fruity hops and orange peel, also notes of Belgian ale yeast and mild spices. The flavour is a bit too sweet for a beer for sweaty farm workers, but still good - also fruity, yeasty and spicy notes, hints of caramel, with a distinct hoppy bitterness and a hint of smoke in the finish.

330 ml draught at Håndverkerstuene. Dark reddish brown colour. Small off-white head.  Rich malty aroma with notes of leather and a light spicy hops. Light Belgian yeast aroma as well. Mellow velvety malt flavours. Low carbonation level, which I guess is caused by the kegs used. Could have used more carbonation to make it livelier. Something in between a saison and their Ardennes Blond. Nicely balanced beer, which I would think would go really well with food.

Bottle at the brewery. Pours a hazy dark orange, 1 finger tan head. Aroma is dusty, funky, hay, belgian yeast, wheat, light fruits, apricots perhaps. Its fairly sweet, but has a nice refreshing semidry finish. Quite like a saison, and a very drinkable and good one at that. Carbonation was too lively, hopefully this will be toned down.

Sampled at the brewery. A powered-up version of their Blondie. A dense offwhite head resting on an unclear, orangey to light amber colored body. Belgo-yeast up front,  slightly perfumed fruitiness with a sour touch. Some mild spices and a whiff of biscuity malts. Taste has a soft malt characther, slightly sweet, with notes of mild spices. A certain funky, acidulous fruitiness underneath. Quite filling. Smooth, almost creamy in the mouth. A very good one, high drinkability!

Tasting at the brewery, but this will be on general release.
Lovely barnyard aroma, saison-like. Brewed with 10% oats, and there is 25% smoked malt, too, but it blends in so well that there is no smoked character. Some Belgian yeast character. Very likeable, would be great with food.
